data.title: Lunar Architecture for Tree Traversal in-service-of Cable Exploration
data.description: LATTICE is a cable-based infrastructure that will enable robotic transport into and out of craters on the Moon. LATTICE targets implementation as the Moonâ€™s first scalable robotic infrastructure.

data.title: Rapidly-exploring Random Tree
data.description: This project involved implementing and simulating the Rapidly-Exploring Random Trees (RRT) algorithm for robotic path planning using ROS2. The focus was on enabling a robot to efficiently navigate complex environments by generating collision-free paths.

data.title: Tripteron
data.description: The Tripteron is a 3-axis parallel motion robot, similar in concept to a delta robot, but with all three input motions configured to be parallel to each other. This "Parallel Axis Tripteron" design leverages a simplified yet efficient kinematic structure for precise movement. While this project focused on developing the mathematical model and simulating the system in ROS2, it lays the groundwork for real-world applications in automation, manufacturing, and precise manipulation tasks. The simulation highlights the robot's potential for high-speed, accurate positioning within a constrained workspace.

data.title: Stewards Platform
data.description: This project involved designing and implementing a stewards platform powered by Metal Gear Servos, utilizing kinematics and PID control for precise motion control.
